The AFP notes the work of other anti-money laundering bodies which have both the capacity and expertise to undertake the extensive work necessary to develop such estimates. Factors such as whether the money is generated from crime in Australia, or sent to or from another jurisdiction, impact on the estimates. Similarly, not all money is processed through normal financial systems or necessarily sent out of the country, making estimates more difficult to determine.
